- Full passthrough logging: route the Claude CLI through ccproxy and log request bodies, including system fields.

Suggested path (fastest)

- Install: pipx install ccproxy-api (or uvx ccproxy-api)
- Ensure Claude CLI works: claude --version and claude (or claude setup-token)
- Start ccproxy with logging:
- CCPROXY_LOG_REQUESTS=true CCPROXY_VERBOSE_API=true CCPROXY_REQUEST_LOG_DIR=/tmp/ccproxy/request ccproxy
- Read the detected system prompt from cache (created on startup):
- cat ~/.cache/ccproxy/claude_headers_*.json | jq '.system_prompt.system_field'
- This is the exact system field Claude CLI sends, preserved as-is.

- jq '.body.system' /tmp/ccproxy/request/*_upstream_request.json to view the system field ccproxy forwarded

REPO_URL="https://github.com/jleechanorg/your-project.com"
# Determine repository URL: argument > env var > git remote > error
REPO_URL=""
# Parse --repo argument
while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
    case "$1" in
        --repo)
            REPO_URL="$2"
            shift 2
            ;;
        *)
            shift
            ;;
    esac
done
# If not set by argument, check environment variable
if [[ -z "$REPO_URL" && -n "$REPO_URL" ]]; then
    REPO_URL="$REPO_URL"
fi
# If still not set, try to get from git remote
if [[ -z "$REPO_URL" ]]; then
    if git rev-parse --is-inside-work-tree >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        REPO_URL="$(git config --get remote.origin.url)"
    fi
fi
# If still not set, print warning and exit
if [[ -z "$REPO_URL" ]]; then
    echo -e "${RED}❌ Repository URL not specified. Use --repo <url> or set REPO_URL env variable.${NC}"
    exit 1
fi

Summary
🔧 Fixed critical bug in exportcommands.py where infrastructure scripts were incorrectly copied to repo root instead of infrastructure-scripts/ directory

Root Cause Analysis
Infrastructure scripts from PR feat: Expand exportcommands infrastructure scripts allowlist #1595 allowlist expansion were being exported locally but not appearing in target repository
Export process was copying scripts individually to repository root instead of infrastructure-scripts/ directory
This caused the expanded script collection (including create_worktree.sh) to be invisible in the claude-commands repository
Technical Fix
File: .claude/commands/exportcommands.py
Method: _copy_to_repository()
Lines: 911-923

Before (Broken):
script_dst = os.path.join(self.repo_dir, script_file)  # ← Wrong: copies to root
After (Fixed):
infra_dir = os.path.join(self.repo_dir, 'infrastructure-scripts')
os.makedirs(infra_dir, exist_ok=True)
script_dst = os.path.join(infra_dir, script_file)  # ← Correct: copies to infrastructure-scripts/
Verification
✅ Local Testing: Export now shows Added/Updated: infrastructure-scripts/create_worktree.sh
✅ Target Repository: PR #15 in claude-commands repo now correctly shows all 17 scripts in infrastructure-scripts/
✅ Functionality: All expanded scripts from PR #1595 now properly exported

Impact
Fixed: Infrastructure scripts allowlist expansion from PR feat: Expand exportcommands infrastructure scripts allowlist #1595 now working correctly
Available: All 17 infrastructure scripts including create_worktree.sh now exported properly
Verified: Target repository structure matches expected infrastructure-scripts/ directory layout

⚠️ Potential issue

Do not store app passwords in plaintext (~/.bashrc).

Writing EMAIL_PASS to shell rc files is a security risk (world-readable backups, accidental commits).

Safer options:

Read EMAIL_PASS at runtime via prompt (no persistence), or
Store in a 0600-protected file not in VCS, e.g.:
# ~/.email_secrets (chmod 600)
EMAIL_USER="<your-email@gmail.com>"
EMAIL_PASS="your-16-char-app-password"
BACKUP_EMAIL="<your-email@gmail.com>"
Then in scripts:

# shellcheck disable=SC1090
[[ -f "$HOME/.email_secrets" ]] && source "$HOME/.email_secrets"

Summary
🔧 Fixed critical bug in exportcommands.py where infrastructure scripts were incorrectly copied to repo root instead of infrastructure-scripts/ directory

Root Cause Analysis
Infrastructure scripts from PR feat: Expand exportcommands infrastructure scripts allowlist #1595 allowlist expansion were being exported locally but not appearing in target repository
Export process was copying scripts individually to repository root instead of infrastructure-scripts/ directory
This caused the expanded script collection (including create_worktree.sh) to be invisible in the claude-commands repository
Technical Fix
File: .claude/commands/exportcommands.py
Method: _copy_to_repository()
Lines: 911-923

Before (Broken):
script_dst = os.path.join(self.repo_dir, script_file)  # ← Wrong: copies to root
After (Fixed):
infra_dir = os.path.join(self.repo_dir, 'infrastructure-scripts')
os.makedirs(infra_dir, exist_ok=True)
script_dst = os.path.join(infra_dir, script_file)  # ← Correct: copies to infrastructure-scripts/
Verification
✅ Local Testing: Export now shows Added/Updated: infrastructure-scripts/create_worktree.sh
✅ Target Repository: PR #15 in claude-commands repo now correctly shows all 17 scripts in infrastructure-scripts/
✅ Functionality: All expanded scripts from PR #1595 now properly exported

Impact
Fixed: Infrastructure scripts allowlist expansion from PR feat: Expand exportcommands infrastructure scripts allowlist #1595 now working correctly
Available: All 17 infrastructure scripts including create_worktree.sh now exported properly
Verified: Target repository structure matches expected infrastructure-scripts/ directory layout
Related PRs

claude-commands PR Add share story functionality #15: Verification of fix in target repository

 Run exportcommands.py locally - confirms correct directory structure
 Check target repository PR - confirms scripts appear in infrastructure-scripts/
 Verify create_worktree.sh specifically present in export
